title: Web 2.0 Technology-Based Mathematics Teacher Education Competency Enhancement Course

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic digital tools and background in mathematics education
context.additional_context: A systematic process for in-service mathematics teachers to master Web 2.0 tools via smartphones, applying constructivist and co-constructivist approaches, with the goal of establishing a sustainable innovation model linked to the T@T mentoring network

learning_goals: Learners can implement constructivist learning environments with over 80% accuracy when designing math lessons using Web 2.0 tools (Google Docs, Padlet, etc.)
Learners can demonstrate and improve interactive math lessons applying digital tools in VR simulation environments three or more times
Learners collaboratively develop two or more math teaching materials reflecting digital literacy-based methodologies through co-construction with peer teachers

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
